citations.narrative:
During records review it was discovered that there were no disposition records for the following animals: twenty-eight
domestic sheep; two Fallow deer; one Emu; two Axis deer; and one Oryx (exchanged for one Bison). In addition, there
was no record for the Bison that was acquired from the Oryx exchange, and the Record of Animals on Hand (animal
inventory) was not up to date, including the aforementioned acquisition and disposition of animals, as well as the birth of a
zebra foal. Acquisition and disposition documents are utilized to keep track of USDA regulated species. Such records are
important as to ensure an accurate count, assessment and proper acquisition and disposition of all animals that the facility
deals, maintains, purchases, and/or resales. Every dealer must make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully
disclose the following information concerning animals other than dogs and cats, purchased, or otherwise acquired,
owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his/her possession or under his/her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized,
or otherwise disposed of by that dealer: The name and address of the person from whom the animals were purchased or
otherwise acquired; the USDA license number of the person if he/she is licensed under the Act; the vehicle license
number and State, and the driver's license number (or photographic identification card if a non-driver and State) and State
of the person, if he/she is not licensed under the act; the name and address of the person to whom an animal was sold or
given; the date of purchase, acquisition, sale, or disposal of the animal(s); the species of the animal(s); and the number of
animals in the shipment.
Correct by: January 11, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
